column4: Why does it say "Permissions Denied" when I try to run a .sh file?
because your currently logged in user either doesn't own the file or it's not marked executable
if you still can't execute the script then you'll have to use sudo.
How do I use sudo to execute it?
you'll have to cd /path/to/script.sh or sudo ./path/to/script.sh
if that's where the file is that should work...unless there's a typos omewhere
follow the link to the site that was posted. My children are all grown up, I don't need to spoon feed anyone anymore :P
issue the same command starting with sudo
that's how you issue commands that require root access, such as installing packages.
I don't understand what you mean.
you can do the same things in gui that you can in terminal, usually (especially in IRC) it is easier and faster to use the command line.
easiest is to cd /to/the/path/of/file and ./filename. If you need root privs to run it, use sudo ./filname
when using sudo, make sure you have a good idea what is going to happen and/or trust where the script/command came from.
